TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListView/SelectedIndexCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList
type ListView.SelectedIndexCollection = class interface IList interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents the collection that contains the indexes to the selected items in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> stores the indexes to the selected items in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. The indexes stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> are index positions within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores all items displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
The following table shows an example of how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores the items of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> and shows their selection states in an example <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
|Index|Item|Selection state in the ListView| |-----------|----------|-------------------------------------| |0|Item1|Unselected| |1|Item2|Selected| |2|Item3|Unselected| |3|Item4|Selected| |4|Item5|Selected|
Based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> example in the previous table, the following table demonstrates how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> would appear.
|Index|Index of selected item in the ListViewItemCollection| |-----------|----------------------------------------------------------| |0|1| |1|3| |2|4|
You can use the properties and methods of this class to perform a variety of tasks with the collection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an index position from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> is one of the indexes stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>. Once you know that the item is in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the index in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndices%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexChanged>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.HeaderStyle%2A> members and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> class. To run this example, paste the following code into a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> object named `ListView1` and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> named `TextBox1`. Call the `InitializeListView` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event handler. This example requires that the event handler is correctly associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexChanged> event.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/VB/form1.vb#1)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/CPP/form1.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/CS/form1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/VB/form1.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

Docs.param: The index of the item in the collection to be added to the .
Docs.summary: Adds the item at the specified index in the array to the collection.
Docs.returns: The number of items in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method will return 0 if the handle has not been created for the owning <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>. (You can determine whether the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> has an associated handle by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.IsHandleCreated%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.) This method will return -1 if the handle has not been created for a virtual <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.

Docs.exception:
The specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of items in the owner .
-or-
The owner is in virtual mode, and the specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an index position from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> is one of the selected indexes stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>. Once you know that an item is in the selected index collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the index in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this method to combine the selected indexes from multiple collections into a single array.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: property int Count { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of items in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property enables you to determine the number of selected items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>. You can then use this value when you are looping through the values of the collection and need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop. If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.MultiSelect%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> is set to `false`, this property returns a value of either 0 or 1 depending on whether an item is selected.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Once you know that an item is in the selected index collection (using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.Contains%2A> method), you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the index in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is always `true` for this collection. The items in the collection can be modified only by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This indexer enables you to get a specific selected index from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>. The index stored in the collection is an index into the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that represents a selected item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> is in virtual mode and the handle for the owner <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> has not been created (you can check this using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.IsHandleCreated%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property), calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.Remove%2A> method will have no effect on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.
